Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the suspect's political affiliations were focused on ISIS and terrorism, rather than being an anti-Trump antifa supporter.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the suspect's interest in anti-Trump and Antifa groups, as it was not relevant to the alleged plot.
Understate: The claim understates the suspect's expressed support for radical jihadist beliefs and terrorism, as well as his desire to carry out an attack similar to previous terrorist incidents.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the suspect was specifically an anti-Trump antifa supporter, as it only focuses on the suspect's Facebook likes without providing a comprehensive analysis of his motivations.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that being anti-Trump and anti-fascist automatically makes a person more likely to be a terrorist.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the suspect's interest in anti-Trump and Antifa groups may not have been directly related to his alleged plot, suggesting that other factors influenced his actions.
